title: Check, Checkmate, Stalemate
content: Check: your king is attacked — you must respond immediately.
Checkmate: king is in check and has no legal escape — game ends.
Stalemate: no legal moves but king is NOT in check — draw.

tryIt.prompt: White to move: deliver checkmate with the queen.

title: Piece Movement Basics
description: Learn how each piece moves and captures.
content: Pawns move forward but capture diagonally.
Knights jump in an L-shape and can hop over pieces.
Bishops move diagonally, rooks move straight, and queens combine both.

tryIt.prompt: White to move: capture the pawn with the king.

title: Piece Values
description: Know which trades are usually good.
content: Typical values: Pawn=1, Knight/Bishop=3, Rook=5, Queen=9.
Winning a queen for a knight is almost always good.
Use values as guidance, not absolute rules.

tryIt.prompt: White to move: can the knight capture the queen?

title: Castling & King Safety
description: Activate your rook and tuck the king away.
content: You can castle only if king and rook have not moved.
Squares between them must be empty, and the king can’t move through check.
Castling is usually the quickest way to make your king safe.

tryIt.prompt: White to move: castle to improve king safety.

title: Opening Principles
description: Develop pieces and claim space early.
content: Develop knights and bishops to active squares.
Avoid moving the same piece many times in the opening.
Castle early when possible.

tryIt.prompt: White to move: develop a piece toward the center.

title: Control the Center
description: Fight for the central squares e4, d4, e5, d5.
content: Central control gives your pieces more freedom.
You can control the center with pawns or pieces.
Challenge your opponent’s center early.

tryIt.prompt: Black to move: challenge White’s center pawn.

title: King + Pawn Endgame
description: Learn how to escort a pawn to promotion.
content: Use your king to support the pawn.
Opposition can help you gain key squares.
Advance carefully to avoid stalemate.

tryIt.prompt: White to move: push the pawn and escort it forward.

title: Rook Checkmate
description: Use rook + king to deliver a basic mate.
content: Cut off the enemy king with the rook.
Bring your king closer to support the mate.
Deliver the final check by squeezing to the edge.

tryIt.prompt: White to move: start the rook mate sequence.

title: Fork
description: One piece attacks two targets at once.
content: Knights are famous for forks because of their L-move.
Goal: attack king + queen/rook, or win material.

tryIt.prompt: White to move: create a knight fork.

title: Pin
description: A piece can’t move because it exposes something valuable.
content: Absolute pin: moving exposes king (illegal).
Relative pin: moving loses queen/rook, still usually bad.

tryIt.prompt: White to move: pin the king’s defender.

title: Skewer
description: Force a piece to move and win what’s behind it.
content: Skewers are like a pin, but the more valuable piece is in front.
Checks often create strong skewers.
Look for a line piece (rook, bishop, queen).

tryIt.prompt: White to move: skewer the king and rook.

title: Discovered Attack
description: Move one piece to reveal an attack by another.
content: A discovered attack often comes with tempo.
If the discovered attack is a check, it’s even stronger.
Line pieces are the usual attackers.

tryIt.prompt: White to move: reveal a rook attack with the bishop.

title: Back Rank Mate
description: Mate a boxed-in king on the back rank.
content: Look for a king trapped by its own pawns.
A rook or queen on the back rank can decide quickly.
Always watch for escape squares.

tryIt.prompt: White to move: find the back-rank idea.

title: Deflection
description: Lure a defender away from its duty.
content: A key defender can be forced to move with a sacrifice.
Deflection opens lines or removes protection.
Combine with checks to make it forcing.

tryIt.prompt: White to move: deflect the defender.
